"Oh, honey -- oh, come on, this is just juvenile."

The Monarch tossed the figure into a small mountain of plastic forming on his right, and discarded of the rest in another small mountain of blister packs to his left. "So, Elan Sleazebaggano, now you know the bitter taste of the Monarch's sting!"

"God, this is pathetic. You're arching toys now."

"And having a great time doing it!"

"Look, Twenty-One was just mad. He'll be back when he's calmed down."

"Good. I want him to see this! I want him to see his empire in ruins!"

Sheila sighed and sat down on the bed, picking up one of the dozens of shoeboxes that had been in Twenty-One's closet. The man really loved his toys. Star Wars, Transformers, Battle Beasts, Ninja Turtles...

"Oh."

"What?" The Monarch looked up at her.

"Uh, nothing."

"What? Let me see. What's he got in there, the desiccated remains of a Cabbage Patch Kid?"

"Uh, no, it's just... photos."

"Photos of you! Oh, gross. I bet they're all sticky. Well, sure was a goooood idea to have him do all our digital archiving, wasn't it, honey?" the Monarch asked sarcastically.

"Well, he was the only henchman who knew how to use a scanner." Sheila pulled out a handful of photographs. "Wow, these go back forever. Here's one of me as Lady Au Pair ... here's one where I was Queen Etheria..."

"Wow, what's this one?"

"That's me as a 'sexy Queen Elizabeth' at a Halloween party in college. Most of these aren't very -- whoops."

A lone photo slipped out of her yellow-gloved hand and fluttered to the bed. The Monarch picked it up. It showed his wife dressed in a very skimpy couple of grape vine garlands that didn't leave much to the imagination.

"Oh, uh, that's from when I Number Two'd for Die-Onysus," Sheila explained. "I hated that costume, I couldn't even sit down without squashing a bunch of grapes all over everything."

"Not exactly flattering, either."

"Oh, uh," Sheila mumbled, embarrassed. "Uh, that's not the costume."

"What?"

"I, uh -- I kind of put on a little weight while I was with Die-Onysus."

"A little?" The Monarch turned the photo this way and that. "That's more than a little."

"Well, I couldn't help it!" Sheila said defensively. "It was all feasts and revels and wild parties. I was drunk off my ass half the time! And every time he arched, I don't even remember anymore, Professor somebody-or-other, the whole time he was talking I had to be eating these giant turkey legs in the background. For an atmosphere of decadence, he said. I put on about forty pounds in a couple of months and by the end of it I was having blackouts from all the drinking. I was lucky to get out of there."

"Oh, I know! Like, half that guy's henchmen are on the Guild's looking-for-donor-liver list, now."

"Yeah, it's depressing. Anyway, my next gig was with Truckules, thank god; the costume wasn't exactly form-fitting. And I lost all the weight carting the stupid thing around." She looked over at her husband. "So now you know my chubby little secret. If this turns into an excuse for fat jokes at my expense..."

"Of course not," said the Monarch. "At least, not until I think of one."

“Do not worry your pretty little head, my former minx.” Die Onysus gently caressed her shoulder. “I will not be attempting world sovereignty by force. “As I said… much has changed since we last saw each other.”

Die-Onysus moved back to his table to pick up a gilded stein and took a long heavy drink. In the soft Florissant lighting Sheila could see what he meant. Gone was the doughy red-nosed merrymaker. Dressed in his new silky snow white toga golden chest armor and brilliant red cape, Die-Onysus was more statuesque. His round portly frame was a little taller, more robust and toned. He still had a generous amount of body fat but a thick layer of muscles clearly supported this. His arms in particular showed well-toned biceps and broad shoulders Sheila had never known him to have. As well his company seemed more imposing than the drunken slobs he once trod around with. The sloppy frat boys and 40 year old drunks he once attracted to his employ. The new hench were all young able bodied girls and boys running the range from their teens to early thirties. Despite many being chubby or plump with a liberal amount of alcohol in them they seemed well disciplined. Not to mention there were the strange Satyr he had acquired. Their fur looked all too real, they were definitely not costumes.

“I would say I’m not the only one who has changed though.” Onysus broke Sheila out of her silent admiration of his new physique. “You have grown to be quite the woman since you left my employ.” Onysus looked Mrs. Monarch up and down with a soft leer. “I see the weight you put on as my number 2 found its way to the right places, I’m not surprised.” Mrs. Monarch became aware just how much Onysus’s gaze had wandered and quickly crossed her arms once more and shot him a stern look.

“Is that really the way you talk to a married woman?” she reproached him.

“Oh ho my,” Die-Onysus chuckled, “Indeed it is, especially one I am as familiar with as I am with you.” He smiled. “Speaking of your husband, I am most gracious of this offer he has uh, extended to me for visit. It really is quite generous of the both of you.”

“Yeah, it sure is.” Sheila rolled her eyes.

Die-Onysus snapped his hands at one of his tubby hand maidens. His minions had already picked up all the spilt dinnerware and returned it to the table. The round girl he had summoned quickly grabbed one of the wide wooden bowls and brought it to Mrs. Monarch. She had always hated these drinking bowls. They were as wide as hubcaps and deep enough to fill with plenty of soup. However, no matter how sober you were it was impossible to drink from them without spilling it all over yourself. She was shocked to see the bowl full to the brim with a thick brown stew. Even after all the mess and spills they had made in bringing the table up here this bowl and indeed many others that she could see still looked topped off.

“I have been hoping for an opportunity to meet and greet some of the residents of this fine community, um you and your husband included of course.” Onysus nodded to her and made himself at home, sprawling out on top of The Monarch’s large round bed before she could protest. “Your invitation affords me with exactly such a favorable occasion. I would like to throw you and your husband a grand celebration as a thank you, and invite everyone who lives in Malice. It would of course be to my benefit as a way of meeting some of your neighbors. But first, come Sheila, let us imbibe!” Die-Onyus raised a bowl of his own in one hand and a golden chalice in the other.

Mrs. Monarch glanced down to her own bowl and tried to shake her head. “I’m not so sure I could really-“

“Nonsense!” Onysus bellowed humorously. “Eat up!”

Mrs. Monarch was about to decline but her stomach suddenly let out a soft gurgle. “Well… maybe a little,” she recanted. Lifting the wide-brimmed bowl to her lips, Sheila tilted the bowl up and started to sip the rich stew. The flavor was amazing. Was his food always this good? she thought to herself. The broth may have been a little heavy with oil but the full-bodied taste was a treat for her taste buds. Without realizing it she started to tilt the bowl up higher, taking bigger sips. The more she ate the better it tasted. Higher and higher the bowl went as her pace increased. Trickles of stew escaped the sides and ran down her cheeks. Sheila took big long gulps from the bowl, often slurping noisily as she ate faster than the soup could flow and had to lift the bowl higher to speed the stew up.

She ate for as long as she could before she had to stop and get some air. Returning the bowl to level only a small layer of stew remained in the bottom. Mrs. Monarch let out a very loud uncouth belch, unable to hold it in. Sheila turned bright red from both her unladylike outburst and how greedily she had eaten.

Die-onysus let out a boisterous laugh. “Good, good!” he chortled. “You’ve not forgotten how to eat like a true member of my court! Now come, finish the bowl and we may discuss business.”

Sheila was just about certain she was full enough as it was, but before she could decline she felt another twinge of hunger in the pit of her stomach. Despite more than a gallon of soup filling up her belly, she really felt like she could manage just that last little bit. However, turning back to her bowl she was shocked to see the stew was nowhere near as depleted as she thought it was, the bowl was just shy of half full. Sheila stared at the stew for a few moments, trying to think of an excuse, but nothing came, only the stew beckoned. Silently she lifted the bowl to her mouth once more and tilted it high. She let the taste wash over her taste buds and began gulping the stew down like a thirsty fish again. Streams of stew flowed down her face and her stomach started to swell into a slight curve as she filled up. But even after consuming what seemed like more than she had before the bowl still seemed to keep flowing.

Sheila couldn’t believe how much was left; the bowl just would not empty. Her pace increased, she tried to eat faster, not just to finish the stew but because it really was good. Holding the bowl nearly vertical she guzzled the stew, lapping up the heavenly broth with her tongue. At last after what seemed like an eternity the bowl yielded the final few drops. What Mrs. Monarch didn’t see was Die-Onysus wave his hand at the bowl just before it finally ran dry. Gasping for air, she held the bowl over her mouth for a few more seconds still trying to shake the last few drops onto her tongue. Finally, she lowered the bowl, her stomach distended into a small paunch from the stew inside her. Dark brown lines ran from the sides of her mouth and down her neck. Wiping away some of the stew on her mouth she tried to hold back another loud burp but could not. Jerking her head back slightly from the force, she tried in vain to cup her hand over her mouth to muffle the sound of her expulsion that filled the room like a trumpet.

“Marvelous” Die- Onysus smiled.

Down in the lower corridors, Monarch was checking room to room looking for his wife and their guests. Sheila came down the elevator behind him and called out. “Mistress Miam-Nad said you came in looking for us,” she explained as she approached him, trying to hold her hands in front of her abdomen to hide how stuffed she was.

“Yeah, I’ve been looking all over, where the hell did that dick disappear to?” Monarch spat, annoyed.

“About that…” Mrs. Monarch trailed off, “first I wanted to ask you something…"

“Oh yeah, I had something I needed to run by you too…” Monarch replied.

“How would you feel about letting Die-Onysus host a party here?” they both asked at the same time.

“Oh ho, so yer into that type of control play eh?” Hatred tried to chat her up but was unable to draw Maim-Nad’s piercing eyes off his young wife’s helpless expression. “Personally I don’t think I could go that far if I let the woman be in charge of the game, but I suppose some fellers just aren’t as rugged and manly as I am. Princess Tinyfeet gasped for air having been unable to think or breathe under Maim-Nad’s crushing gaze. She was like a deer caught in the powerful woman’s headlights.
“Well I’ve actually been trying to stay sober tonight” Hatred scratched the back of his head nervously “When I drink I have a tendency to overdo it and pass out, I was really looking forward to what the missus and I were gonna do once we go home later ya see…”
“Mhmm” Maim-Nad narrowed her eyes as she smiled politely and nodded to a chubby woman in a loose fitting robe who approached with a pitcher of sweet wine. The curvaceous woman held the pitcher out under the Sargent’s nose to let the heady aroma fill his nostrils. Her other hand reached around and playfully worked its way under the collar of Harted’s shirt as she rubbed his shoulder.
“Oh my that does smell pretty darn good” Hatred found himself saying as if on impulse, the smell alone making his head swim. The voluptuous Maenad giggled in his ear and pulled the pitcher away letting Hatred follow it with his nose. Slowly she guided Hatred away letting him take small sips and tugging at his collar. Hatred quickly grew flush and his head seemed to cloud as the drink overwhelmed him.
“Ah-“ Princess Tinyfeet tried to call out to her husband but Hatred was quickly led away into the crowd. She turned back to her new captor to find Maim-Nad holding out a large leg of lamb dribbling with a thick sauce for the helpless girl to eat, a crule smile spread across the olive toned woman’s face.

Before she could even look for a new source a helpful cherub fluttered to her side instantly and held aloft a golden amphora pouring a thick stream of new booze into her glass.
Sheila just smiled warmly her cheeks already turning crimson, Monarch meanwhile swatted at the small winged caterer in annoyance. “Shoo, get out of here, I thought I told you things you can’t come to the party!”
“Aw it’sh fine sweetie, really” His wife patted the Monarch on the back “Everyone is having a good time see?” Shila gestured around them to their neighbors and friends. The party was growing more loud and lively by the minute. Everyone it seemed was really beginning to cut loose, modesty quickly disappearing. All around them the Cherubs were fluting about topping off beverages and plates. Toga dressed women and men who had been serving people just a short time ago were working their way through the crowd getting rather friendly with singles and couples alike offering to give them body massage or feed them grapes.

“Wow Hatred getting loving from two mature women?” Monarch was dumbfounded “Then what happened to his little leashed kid bride?”
“Ugh” Mrs. Monarch grunted into her glass tilting it back to drain it dry, she pointed in the direction of Maim-Nad’s lounger where the imposing woman was reclined with the small girl straddling her midrift. The little girl’s dress was even tighter as a packed belly pressed on the dress. Maim-Nad was ordering the obedient girl to feed her new mistress hunks of rich cake. Every time the girl leaned forward with a new piece the larger woman would take advantage of her lowered guard and cram a buttery pastry or greasy slab of meat into the girl’s mouth. Despite the forceful stuffing the girl was forbidden to choke or spit out the food and had to eat everything Maim-Nad shoved into her. Suddenly Maim-Nad got a wicked idea in her head and shot forward knocking the poor girl onto her back. Quickly pinning her down Maim-Nad tipped her large chalice of wine onto the girl’s face. Princess Tinyfeet spat and gagged for a moment before finally accpeting her fate and drinking in the flow. The small girl no match for the powerful alcohol felt her mind grow fuzzy. Before the Monarch had finished watching the spectacle Maim-Nad had an entire decanter of wine held up for the girl to chug. Princess Tinyfeet greedily slurping down the sweet nectar as fast as she could manage despite her already packed gut.
Monarch turned to find his wife accepting another refill of her own wine from her own personal cherub as well as a plate of Souvlaki. “Well that resolution certainly stood the test of time” Monarch sarcastically rolled his eyes. The Monarch glanced down at the zipper on his wife’s dress start to feel the pressure push on it once more as the cherub urged her to start eating..
The Monarch didn’t have time to chase the cherub away however as more soon arrived. A chalice of his own was quickly forced into his hands and the Monarch was finding himself in a similar state. The wine making everything feel comfortable. The Husband and wife villain team were guided to a table where they could relax leaned against one another and brought all the wine and food they could manage. The zipper on Sheila’s dress creaked and slipped down a few notches.
Die-onysus watched with a grin as his gracious hosts were being coddled and fed by a swarm of cherubs. All around him the other party goers were finding themselves overwhelmed by booze and food. The party collapsing into drunken groping and hedonistic indulgence.

"How's everyone doing?" Onysus bellowed to the assembled partygoers.

A deafening cheer washed back over him from the plastered crowd. Sloshing goblets were thrust into the air, drenching the room and the guests with every kind of alcohol imaginable. Onysus nodded with satisfaction and signaled to the satyrs, who drew long trumpets from beneath the tables and put them to their lips.

At the sound of the multi-toned blast, the party-goers turned to face Die-Onysus. It would be wrong to say they were "disciplined", exactly. They were rowdy, sloppy, and completely shitfaced. And yet the group as a whole took on a sort of cohesiveness, a sense of purpose beneath a thick coat of chaos, as if a spell had fallen over them like a net and suddenly been drawn tight.

"Now, my grand bacchanal, my army," the villain said, climbing up on the table, "are you ready to party?"

"YES!"

"Are you ready to shake the world with the force of our revelry?"

"YES!"

"Then follow me, and I promise you, the rivers will flow with wine! The forces of boredom and lameness will be crushed beneath our sandals! Oh, they may call the police with a noise complaint! They may even call out the army! But will we let that kill the party?"

"NO!"

"Then tonight, my grand bacchanal, we rock!" Die-Onysus thrust one beefy finger towards the exit. In moments, the heavy doors had been torn off their hinges as the crowd thundered forth in an unstoppable wave.

All she knew was that she was surrounded by the overpowering odor of orange chicken. After several seconds of serious thought, she managed to figure out that it was because she'd passed out face down in a pile of it. She rolled over onto her back and slid off the buffet table, feeling more than a little overcooked.

She looked around. She was in some sort of lavish restaurant, stocked with a dozen long buffet tables covered with every type of food imaginable.

"God, what happened?" she wondered. "Was I up all night eating?"

The uncomfortably stuffed sensation in her stomach certainly seemed to support that possibility. She could barely bend at the waist, she was so full. She put a hand against the table for support; her head was spinning, and she didn't want to lose everything in her stomach. Her rumpled costume was already messy enough from all the orange sauce.

Carefully, she worked her way along the table towards the drink dispenser. She'd been sweaty copiously in her sleep (not to mention all the alcohol she'd downed) and now she was parched enough to drink about a gallon of lemonade.

She tripped over something and nearly fell. Looking down, she saw--

"A member of the SWAT team?" she murmured, nudging the unconscious body with her toe. "What did we do last night?"

"Why don't you ask Randall freaking Flagg out there?" a familiar voice said from behind her. "I'm sure he's about to give another speech aaaaall about it."

Sheila turned to see her husband, dressed in the top half of his costume and a pair of boxer shorts and looking like he'd been hit by a few buses sometime during the night. He was taking tiny sits from a mug of coffee with "I HEART LAS VEGAS" printed on it.

"Honey, are we in--"

"Yep," the Monarch said with a shrug, "apparently, we spent last night conquering Las Vegas. Excuse me, 'New Dionysia'. All morning it's been 'today, New Dionysia, tomorrow, the world!' That guy is even harder to take when you're hung over."

"We took over--?" Sheila sputtered. "This is a disaster! This is--this is all-out war, and we're in it! Why didn't you wake me up earlier?"

He took another sip. "You looked so cute sleeping in the chicken like that."

It looked like any other ordinary suburban house. Shutters, aluminum siding, and a neatly trimmed lawn. But if you entered through the tastefully decorated foyer and climbed the beige-carpeted stairs, you would find a room with a locked door -- and through the crack beneath that door, the bright magenta glow of a neophyte's flashy, undisciplined magic.

The sound of mournful wailing filled the air, and a chant arose.

Darkness of sin, heed my call,
Drain the souls from one and all,
Fire ants will eat their eyes,
And in the dark the shadows RIIISE!

Triana clicked the 'pause' button of her Shuffle. "I don't know, Raven -- I mean, I liked Screamchill's first album, but this one is so..."

"Corporate?" her boyfriend offered.

"Yeah. And practically half the songs on here are about zombies!" Triana gestured with the crook of her finger and another potato clip zoomed out of bag next to her bed, looped-the-loop over her prone form, and dropped into her mouth. "I mean -- mph -- that's just passe, you know?"

"You're getting pretty good at that," Raven observed. "Remember you used to have to be looking right at whatever you wanted to levitate, and those incantations? Now you hardly even have to move."

"They're just potato chips. They're about the lightest thing there is." She smiled. "But thanks. Now I need to focus on reducing the level of thaumic overspill -- uh, the light, I mean. It's still kind of sloppy."

"You'll get there. You've been practicing a lot."

Triana waggled her fingers again, but nothing happened; the tendrils of her mind couldn't seem to get a hold on the next chip. A moment later, she rolled over with a grunt and opened the bag the old fashioned way. No wonder; it was empty. She crumpled it up with her mind and tossed it over her shoulder into the trash, where it joined a Cheetos bag, a Thin Mints box, and a flattened tub of popcorn.

"I have, haven't I?" She wasn't going to have much of an appetite for dinner, that was for sure. "I'd better watch that, you know? I'm not getting as much exercise lately, since I can't go dancing--"

She clapped her mouth shut, too late, and felt a blush creeping into her cheeks as her gaze flicked over to his crutches. "Sorry, I -- I meant --"

"It's okay," Raven said. "You know, if you want to go out dancing with your friends sometimes, it's totally cool. I mean, we'll always have movie night, right?"

What friends?, Triana thought. Kim would just give Triana an earful about how dancing was sinful, and Dean -- well, she didn't even want to think about what his idea of "popular" dance might be. Probably something like a slow waltz, but without the touching.

"Nah, it's okay. Really." She shrugged. "All this telekinesis probably burns off just as many calories, in the long run, you know?"

She said it with such sincerity she even managed to convince herself.

It was a conundrum, all right. Triana's stomach wanted breakfast, but her bed was so warm and cozy...

She snuggled under the covers, trying to wriggle back into the grasp of the sandman's fingers, but another insistent pang of hunger reminded her that she hadn't eaten since ... well, since that midnight snack, but still, that had been hours ago!

But maybe there was a way she could satisfy her hunger without getting out of bed. Hmm. I wonder if I can manage it from all the way up here?, she thought. Only one way to find out.

Questing fingers of thaumic power oozed their way down the staircase, under the door, and into the kitchen. Grasping, she opened the cupboard -- removed the box of Fruity Mummy -- opened the fridge -- removed the milk -- closed the door --

It was a delicate series of operations, especially because she had to do the whole thing using only her arcane sight. By the time she had the milk and the box of cereal resting next to her bed, she was exhausted.

What a workout ... oh, damn! I forgot the bowl! Well, she wasn't getting out of bed now, not after all that. She emptied her mind, let it "cool off" for a few moments, then heaved the milk and cereal back into the air, lifting them directly over her face. She tried not to think about what would happen if she lost her grip -- if she thought about it too much, she almost certainly would.

She tipped the box, filling her open mouth with cereal, then tipped the half-empty gallon jug of and sloshed milk over it. She overestimated slightly, and ended up almost spattering it across her face, but she got plenty of it in her mouth as well. Cheeks bulging, she chewed the enormous mouthful.

How about that? I got myself breakfast in bed.

It tasted a little weird because she'd picked up the chocolate milk -- all milk looked the same on the astral plane! -- but still, she was pleased with herself. She kept practicing, and had the pour down perfectly by the time she ran out of cereal.

"Triana, honey!" her stepfather called up the stairs. "Are you ready to go?"

Go? Oh, right! She was supposed to be visiting Dad this weekend. Well, time for another challenge -- could she get dressed using only her magic?

Giving herself plenty of room, she stood in the middle of the floor and lifted her arms. With a whisk of mental power, her nightie slipped over her head and flew across the room. From there, it was almost too easy; bra, shirt, stockings, they all went on easily. Only the skirt gave her a little bit of trouble; she had to force the clasp together by hand. Apparently, that was a little too complicated for her magic as of yet -- But a few more mornings like this, and I'm sure I won't have to worry about it anymore, she reassured herself.

One look back at her pillow -- which was soaked with milk and covered in loose Fruity Mummy pieces -- was enough to convince her that she should probably do her makeup the old-fashioned way, at least for now.

-------

A swirling vortex opened the in the sky above the mountain highway, and out of it stormed a pale horse with two riders. The ethereal stallion landed on the asphalt, leaving hoofprints of purple flame.

"Here we are; the Venture compound!" the Outrider said.

Triana slid off the horse's back and looked over the steel safety railing. "What gives? We're like two miles from the front gates."

"Oops," the Outrider said sheepishly. "I must have steered us back onto the material plane a little prematurely. Well, it's a lovely day; why don't we walk?"

He eyed his stepdaughter. His "miscalculation" had actually been entirely intentional; Tatyana had suggested it. Frankly, Triana could use the exercise. She'd barely moved a muscle all week, and it was starting to show. The "Neophyte 15", they called it. It was easy to put on a few pounds if you started relying on magic for everything, and just as the girl was an exceptional student of the arcane, it had taken her an exceptionally short time to get soft and sloppy, especially around the middle. That skirt had always been a muffin top waiting to happen -- and now the prophecy was coming to pass.

Still, you just didn't come right out and tell a teenager that she was getting fat, particularly not when she'd just learned to set someone's soul on fire two days ago. Hopefully, a little walk would stir her out of her rut.

"S'okay, I know the way," Triana said. "Thanks for the lift. I can get there on my own from here."

"Well, if you're sure -- you've got your phone if there's any trouble!"

"I'll be fine. See you on Sunday evening!"

Triana waited until the vortex had winked shut, then walked over to the railing. It was a long way down. She lifted herself into the air, just a couple of inches, but enough to be sure that she could keep from plummeting. When she was satisfied, she stepped over the railing and began gliding towards the Venture compound far below, descending on a cushion of air.

Who needed walking?

Triana spent the better part of the next two hours running through the same song with Hank, Dermott and H.E.L.P.E.R. It was a comfortable prison -- when you were one of the world's top mercenaries, you could afford a very nice house -- but it was a prison all the same, to a woman who was used to fast cars and effortless backflips.

Billy did what he could for her, which didn't amount to much more than the advice, bandages, and a bottle of painkillers. She tossed him a wad of bills anyway, which that albino friend of his would undoubtedly piss away on video games, and shooed him out.

She laid there for a while until she could no longer stand the feel of the sweaty latex of her suit against her skin, and peeled it off like a used surgical glove. Then she hobbled to the bathroom and carefully drew a deep, bubbly bath. The hot water felt wonderful. Once she was in her civvies -- a pink sweatsuit -- she felt considerably better about things.

Maybe this wasn't a sentence after all. Maybe it was more like... a vacation. A rare chance to relax. The SPHINX operation was over. Monstroso had his own wounds to tend to. Samson thought she was dead -- at least she hoped he'd bought it -- and if her Black Hearts really had been eliminated, she didn't have a business to look after.

Her stomach rumbled -- she hadn't eaten since lunch yesterday, and now the sun was almost up. She thought of the case of tasteless protein shakes chilling in her refrigerator. Her lips curved up in a smile.

14111.content:
Molotov floated upon the pristine blue waters, a squeaky pool chair cradling her body. Her leg felt much improved, but it was still far too soon to go jogging. Nevertheless, a week of lying around doing nothing much more than eating had made her antsy. She needed to get some kind of training in.

Without looking, she drew the long throwing knife from the leg of her swimsuit and flung it. The dual thunk-thud as it hit one of the neighbor's apples and knocked it to the ground was very satisfying. At least she still had her aim. With two more quick flicks of her wrist, she knocked down two more.

Perfect. I haven't lost my touch. Unfortunately, just as she finished congratulating herself, she heard another sound. A hissing sound. Apparently, the last time she'd shifted her position on the raft, one of the hidden knives had punctured it.
She tried to the paddle to the side, but her ribs hurt if she leaned too far; she wasn't going to make it. Within a few second, her butt dipped under the surface.

"Should have sprung for heated pool," she muttered, standing up to her shoulders in chilly water. She hadn't really intended to go in it. Molotov was more of a floater than a swimmer; if you were in the water, you hadn't planned a good enough escape route.

Uncomfortably, she heaved herself up onto the pink tile, feeling stabs of pain in her sore muscles. She got to her feet with the aid of one of the deck chairs and limped stiffly into the house. Stupid, stupid idea. What if I'd been over the deep end? Now that would have been an embarrassing way to die.

She stopped in the foyer and checked herself over in the mirrored doors, just in case any gaping wounds had reopened. Nope -- she looked good. Healthy. Even a little bit... "robust". All those calories she'd been scarfing down hadn't just been vanishing into thin air, apparently. She smoothed the black fabric of her bathing suit over the slight curve of her stomach. It really wasn't much, but she'd never been even a little pudgy before.

Molotov shrugged. Oh well; it was nothing to worry over. The fact that five or ten pounds overweight was literally the fattest she'd ever been was proof enough that her lifestyle would melt the chub off her frame soon enough, once she had her old life back.

Stripping off the wet suit and leaving it in a sodden heap on the marble floor -- and the bandolier of knives on the hall table -- she retired to her bed to spend the next few hours practicing her aim in a different way: catching bonbons in her mouth.
